title: Ingredient
text:
An ingredient is a substance that forms part of a <a href="mixture">mixture</a> (in a general sense). For example, in <a href="cooking">cooking</a>, <a href="recipe">recipe</a>s specify which ingredients are used to prepare a specific dish. Many commercial <a href="product%20%28business%29">products</a> contain <a href="secret%20ingredient">secret ingredient</a>s that are purported to make them better than competing products. In the pharmaceutical industry, an <a href="active%20ingredient">active ingredient</a> is that part of a <a href="Pharmaceutical%20formulation">formulation</a> that yields the effect expected by the customer.
<a href="Sovereign%20state">National</a> <a href="law">law</a>s usually require prepared food products to display a list of ingredients, and specifically require that certain <a href="food%20additive">additives</a> be listed.
In most developed countries, the law requires that ingredients be listed according to their relative weight in the product. If an ingredient itself consists of more than one ingredient (such as the cookie pieces which are a part of "cookies and cream" flavor ice cream), then that ingredient is listed by what percentage of the total product it occupies, with its own ingredients displayed next to it in brackets.
The term constituent is often used to refer to <a href="chemical%20substance">substance</a>s that constitute the tissue of living beings. Thus all ingredients are <a href="wikt%3Aconstituent%23Noun">constituent</a>s, but not all constituents are ingredients.
